3.15.18  2:19 pm   there are so many ways to make music... then hoe come every time i fool around on the piano it's so bad?

     maybe that's not one of the ways, or at least not one of the good ways

3.15.18  1:48 pm   Hey i really like this local band and I want to play some of their songs. I cant find any cords to accompany singing online though as they have a relatively small fanbase (I mean it's pretty great considering they're local). But is there a way to find chords to play from their music?

     use your ears, which is what you should always do anyway because what you find online is probably hopelessly wrong

3.15.18  1:44 pm   3.14.18  3:15 pm I have an audio interface, so you would say it would work just connecting the  piano to the interface with midi cables,

     oh, i thought you were doing audio. if it's audio, use an audio cable and then probably USB to the computer. if it's MIDI, you probably don't need an interface it's probably just USB, but if your keyboard is really old you would actually need a MIDI interface and MIDI cables, and then who knows how it would connect to the computer because it's probably older than USB. oh i almost forgot, i don't think audacity does MIDI, that's probably why i assumed you were doing audio

     and then the interface to the computer? I've tried something like that before but the computer didnt respond to me playing..

     you also need a driver which you can usually download for free from the company's website

3.14.18  9:02 pm   How come almost everyone would say that a song is in the key of C# instead of the key of Db,

     if it's major it is usually called Db, because that's less degrees in the key signature. but in a loud room, it might be better to verbally say "C#" because if you say Db they might think you said Bb

     but the key of Eb as opposed to the key of D# seems to be the norm,

     right, that's because D# major spelled out properly with letters would have to be D#, E# Fx(double sharp), G#, A#, B#, and Cx(double sharp)

      or F# instead of Gb etc?

     F# and Gb are equivalent choices because they each have 6 degrees in the key signature, but it may be more often called F# for two reasons. one is kind of like the C#/Db case where F# is more verbally clear in a crowded room, but also it is more common for keys to borrow flatter notes than sharper ones. which creates no problems at all in F# where as in Gb it immediately creates double flats. actually i can think of a 3rd reason. F# as a note would be much more common than Gb because F# is the first note to go, in sharp keys. where as in flat keys Gb is is the 5th note to go. so people are already more accustomed to verbally hearing the words "F#" than Gb

      I know the chord name or even the note name will change depending on what key you're in. Nobody would say that Ab is the 3rd of Emajor because you go up the scale alphabetically and you don't want two A's (Ab and A natural)...

     that's right

      Maybe I'm wrong, but it seems to me the names of key signatures themselves, are kind of set in stone for the most part

     only when the choice is obvious

      Like, if I played you a song in Bb and asked you what key it was in... wouldn't you say Bb instead of A#?

     that's an extremely obvious case. Bb only has 2 flats where as the key of A# major would have 10 sharps. spelled out would be A#, B#, C double sharp, D#, E#, F double sharp, G double sharp

      Or is that just me?

3.14.18  8:02 pm   what are you doing when you are not answering these questions?

3.14.18  7:11 pm   What do I do if I don't like the sound of my singing voice? I actually think I'm a pretty good singer in terms of having a good sense of pitch, and I have a pretty solid range. But I just don't have that extra 'oomph'.. Maybe people might like the vocal melodies, but nobody's gonna listen to me singing and be like 'wow, this person has a great voice'. I feel like there's a difference between being a good singer and having a good voice if that makes sense. 

     try improvising the lyrics. i think you may discover something

3.14.18  7:05 pm   memorize circle of fifths? I need to write the notes on the staff.. but i don't know where they are placed

     it's a pattern, it just keeps going up by 5ths, or down by 4ths. zig zag it. up a 5th, down a 4th, then maybe down 2 4ths if you hit the edge

3.14.18  1:29 pm   What's the best way to count a large number of very tiny things that are constantly moving around? They are too small to get a picture with my phone. I work at an aquaculture place and we breed these little aquatic insects that are used in a lot of water-quality testing places. Basically we put an adult in a medicine cup and each week count the number of babies the adult produces. So, somehow, I'm supposed to count like usually between 40-50 of these borderline - microscopic baby bugs that are all swimming around in a tiny container. Im supposed to get an EXACT count and it's damn near impossible. Help?

     you just need a better camera
